options.description: Move data from Binary to JSON

properties.description: From and to where data should be moved

properties.name: setAllData
properties.description: Whether all JSON data should be replaced with the data retrieved from binary key. Else the data will be written to a single key.

properties.name: sourceKey
properties.description: The name of the binary key to get data from. It is also possible to define deep keys by using dot-notation like for example: "level1.level2.currentKey".

properties.name: destinationKey
properties.description: The name the JSON key to copy data to. It is also possible to define deep keys by using dot-notation like for example: "level1.level2.newKey".

properties.name: convertAllData
properties.description: Whether all JSON data should be converted to binary. Else only the data of one key will be converted.

options.description: Whether to keep the binary data as base64 string

options.description: Choose the character set to use to encode the data

options.description: The file name to set

options.name: jsonParse
options.description: Whether to run JSON parse on the data to get proper object data

options.name: keepSource
options.description: Whether the source key should be kept. By default it will be deleted.

options.name: keepAsBase64
options.description: Whether to keep the binary data as base64 string

options.name: mimeType
options.description: The mime-type to set. By default will the mime-type for JSON be set.

options.description: Whether to use data as is and do not JSON.stringify it

triggerTimes

  • Hours: 0 - 23
  • Day of Month: 1 - 31
  • Months: 0 - 11 (Jan - Dec)
  • Day of Week: 0 - 6 (Sun - Sat)

name: @n8n/n8n-nodes-langchain.lmChatDeepSeek
description: For advanced usage with an AI chain

properties.displayName: This node must be connected to an AI chain. Insert one
properties.name: notice

properties.displayName: If using JSON response format, you must include word "json" in the prompt in your chain or agent. Also, make sure to select latest models released post November 2023.
properties.name: notice
model
properties.description: The model which will generate the completion. Learn more.

properties.name: options
properties.description: Additional options to add

options.name: frequencyPenalty
options.description: Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim

options.name: maxTokens
options.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion. Most models have a context length of 2048 tokens (except for the newest models, which support 32,768).

options.name: Text
options.description: Regular text response

options.name: JSON
options.description: Enables JSON mode, which should guarantee the message the model generates is valid JSON

options.name: presencePenalty
options.description: Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics

options.name: temperature
options.description: Controls randomness: Lowering results in less random completions. As the temperature approaches zero, the model will become deterministic and repetitive.

options.name: timeout
options.description: Maximum amount of time a request is allowed to take in milliseconds

options.name: maxRetries
options.description: Maximum number of retries to attempt

options.name: topP
options.description: Controls diversity via nucleus sampling: 0.5 means half of all likelihood-weighted options are considered. We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.
